document.title: Maryland Comprehensive Health Education Framework: Pre-Kindergarten Through High School

CDFE87EDEBD54F79A26FCB215ACC0EA3.description:
Identify ways that
health messages and
communication
techniques can be
altered for different
audiences.

27E982C75D8A40B1A18E1F3EF1E6F189.description:
Work cooperatively to
advocate for healthy
individuals, families, and
schools.

8C575CE510564E50B0D7489B21F35808.description:
Demonstrate how to
influence and support
others to make positive
health choices.

1BD7721C2CF34F068971903B63034F97.description:
State a health-enhancing position on a
topic and support it with
accurate information.

5FFBF60E18774CB783A7435ACAB267C8.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to advocate for personal, family, and community health.

6C4714115AA041DEB666258386347E5E.description:
Demonstrate behaviors
that avoid or reduce
health risks to self and
others.

88733E6A1A804917B15146EA13C2B74E.description:
Demonstrate healthy
practices and behaviors
that will maintain or
improve the health of
self and others.

53D3183BEE3C4D398A6B61F79E945651.description:
Explain the importance
of assuming
responsibility for
personal health
behaviors.

20455625933147D0AF636121CC71B98F.description:
Students will demonstrate the ability to practice health-enhancing behaviors and avoid or reduce
health risks.

0E9540E4C50C48E69E958C213B41D1BA.description:
Describe how personal
health goals can vary
with changing abilities,
priorities, and
responsibilities.

5CCB89E2058C47E797B5C8B4E8B1E7EB.description:
Apply strategies and
skills needed to attain a
personal health goal.

DE08B94770334C6BB77F1A50D8C2416C.description:
Develop a goal to adopt,
maintain, or improve a
personal health practice.

C4A3FC89577E475A81C22D914021C7A0.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.

055EC7D9A9754D9DB324F1D4999099EB.description:
Analyze the outcomes of
a health-related
decision.

DB9954855C6A4422B98E58783C11B2AE.description:
Choose healthy
alternatives over
unhealthy alternatives
when making a decision.Â

884617C575E94918BDBCC145FCD35647.description:
Predict the potential
short-term impact of
each alternative on self
and others.

85E990BB4BD54C3E8AEEA741A2467407.description:
Distinguish between
healthy and unhealthy
alternatives to health-related issues or
problems.

C5FDC917920E4C64A05193DA71266C11.description:
Distinguish when
individual or
collaborative decision-making is appropriate.

D43B0225B6EF4D028603940996FC2AC0.description:
Determine when health-related situations
require the application
of a thoughtful decision-making process.

A0A0470D183741708747FA74EC6F585D.description:
Identify circumstances
that can help or hinder
healthy decision-making.

A1626FDE2F09425FAFD441292886194B.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.

C38F0FA2638B447AB65343F51B240FF7.description:
Demonstrate how to ask
for assistance to
enhance the health of
self and others.Â

73DCCFFF9F264CEFA3F15FFADA1B9746.description:
Demonstrate effective
conflict management or
resolution strategies.

BF0979852797490CA6E260E174E82CC4.description:
Demonstrate refusal
and negotiation skills to
avoid or reduce health
risks.

1425431C24BF40279E9951933BF948CD.description:
Apply effective verbal
and nonverbal
communication skills to
enhance health.Â

199EB90D15EF4DCE91F5BBE01A720559.description:
Students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health
and avoid or reduce health risks.Â

E3C0C5F7F0B04751A72567A80E5FC3BE.description:
Locate valid and reliable
health products and
services.

482F90CB2AFD4D4CA1629422DCD9D8BF.description:

may require
professional health
services.

CF71F1D6F4C747EE8E828CB1FCCED48D.description:

accessibility of products
that enhance health.Â

1D69BE7D75194578820304A9018F1D4B.description:
Access valid health
information from home,
school, and community.

4A52D81EE1734436A1449BA3EE847EC5.description:
Analyze the validity of
health information,
products, and services.

6332B0DFE2B64FBD8941FE1208F9D150.description:
Students will demonstrate the ability to access valid information, products, and services to enhance
health.

95448BDC614E41629B95804ABFDCEA9E.description:
Explain how school and
public health policies
can influence health
promotion and disease
prevention.Â

9AC65594C1144B4FA3F40AD3326FCEED.description:
Describe how some
health risk behaviors can
influence the likelihood

behaviors.

6F3A01BFDDA84354A2467C3CC86256E8.description:

personal values and
beliefs on individual

15344DA94E2546C1AC63BDCB1FEEADAA.description:
Explain how the
perceptions of norms
influence healthy and
unhealthy behaviors.

F48F7164CE91453BB183DF1AB54AE6B7.description:
Analyze the influence of
technology on personal
and family health.

6BC5DC8F7EBF4DF690C4AFA4A11F5FAF.description:
Analyze how messages
from media influence
health behaviors.Â

9245BAF256F54628B29AFE5CB93A4B92.description:
Analyze how the school
and community can
affect personal health
practices and behaviors.Â

40610702D9844DDC83CC60D4D48D1459.description:
Describe how peers
influence healthy and
unhealthy behaviors.Â

1FD8E28397204056A24A1C430C9BDD8D.description:
Describe the influence
of culture on health
beliefs, practices, and
behaviors.

82D4082E7979462DAA9EA49B59D5C77E.description:
Examine how the family
influences the health of
adolescents.

3ED0CEC2C77B4C7498B38E6AA9745D15.description:
Students will analyze the influence of family, peers, culture, media, technology, and other factors on
health behaviors.

77FFCFBEE3924A6BAF25CA80C346A576.description:
Explain why it is important to protect
oneself against potential skin damage
from exposure to the sun.Â

0969D2CE86DC494DB64868395EB263DD.description:
Explain the benefits of good hygiene
practices for promoting health.

BFDD25BC83654DE19B6074D2EFB7A713.description:
Describe the typical signs, symptoms,
consequences, and treatment of
common STIs including HIV.

AE8F68ECBFCD4EEB9344676477A5CC53.description:
Describe ways to decrease the spread
of STIs including HIV through
abstinence, using condoms
consistently and correctly when having
sex, reducing oneâs number of sexual
partners, and practicing universal
precautions.

C42C8F902ADE49C29FA82EFC5508E9E2.description:
Identify how the most common
Sexually Transmitted Infections (STIs)
are transmitted.

C11BEE70498E407DBE74DC6A67035785.description:
Explain the relationship between
intravenous drug use and transmission
of infections such as HIV and hepatitis.

DFB8E19F92B14719AD91266246956034.description:
Explain the behavioral and
environmental factors that contribute
to chronic diseases including cancer,
cardiovascular disease, and diabetes.

5920B20422D24D69B6662F021A1D5FDC.description:
Explain the significance of
reading a nutrition facts
label ingredient list.

0CAEF038249F49DEA55E8D15E727630C.description:

added sugar.

F8E920047F5A42A095F1116A3B8DF4C0.description:
Summarize the benefits of
limiting the consumption of
trans fat, saturated fat,
added sugar, and sodium.

1B5E990C05B54F618B5C3EC9DA00AB6F.description:
Explain the relationship
between access to foods
and personal food choices.

CF8FA86D705A4B9C9E74D18B6B53BA46.description:
Examine added sugar
content in beverages.Â Â

72B6CEE311C640DD9A75A734C98DBA5C.description:
Explain the benefit of
nutritious foods and the
idea that âall foods fit.â

1910E26778A9418D933F9F487684569F.description:
Summarize a variety of
nutritious food choices for

C4658F99DAAD4578BFC3F46485560917.description:
Explain why the
recommended amount of
food and food group
portions vary by individual.

67492D8313E44635AFF3EB5B28E6DD31.description:
Identify the need to
empower and support
people who experience
racism, harassment, or
abuse.

035903EB6FFF483D90BC32227C12E3A1.description:
Explain why a person
who has been sexually
mistreated, groomed,
harassed, abused,
assaulted, or exploited
is not at fault.

D18F40407C214FEA83086BE61CA4856B.description:
Demonstrate ways to be
a positive bystander by
responding or reporting
if someone is being
sexually mistreated,
groomed, harassed,
abused, assaulted, or
exploited.Â

A2D2ACA8F6B44E6AAEB83DBA3CD7FD87.description:
Bystander intervention
and compassion for
victims

AA7ACB6338754269BBDB3A6056D2F74D.description:
Identify the process of
reporting incidents of
harassment, stalking,
and other intimidating
behaviors.

35107F9F46374EBDB212198E676C6970.description:
Trusted adults and
responding to safety
threats

021A24E45AE8405996EB7AB93705716A.description:
Analyze laws, policies,
and consequences
related to sexual
mistreatment,
grooming, harassment,
abuse, assault,
exploitation, and human
trafficking that are
designed to protect
young people.

36EF9208176A4CB8A38A619A8337D32E.description:
Identify a source of
support that a student
can go to if they or
someone they know is
being sexually
mistreated, groomed,
harassed, abused,
assaulted, or exploited.

424DAA5206794C948002D743F6CD4FA9.description:
Identify power
differences in
relationships between
potential abusers and
their victims.

FF783596B7E343298112A37BFF6456DD.description:
Describe how prejudice,
discrimination, and bias

identify strategies for
intervention.

77BE758E1CC640C19668C7A17A33EFFD.description:
Analyze techniques that
are used to coerce or
pressure someone to
use violence.

14F7410641584881B2E2F64C5B2DD973.description:
Identify a variety of
non-violent ways to
respond to stress when
angry or upset.

D9B1F9BD227B4C4C988CD32DDC0DE735.description:
Analyze how situations
and/or impulsive
behaviors can lead to
violence.

402351B1D7EE484781CEA70196685CE6.description:
Analyze the influence of
peer groups as they

intimidating behaviors.

6CF7CB4D26F7452285D4E4EFCAD3F5A5.description:
Describe helping
behaviors that prevent
violence.

7D833467CB164E56AD7660BD7A252BF3.description:
Explain why individuals
have the right to refuse
sexual contact.

75BA667F42C242BC8A064168068E86B5.description:

inappropriate use of
technology as it relates
to harassment, stalking,
and other intimidating
behaviors.

C74B558A5AB74603871F2A2C6630F12B.description:
Analyze the impact of
media influences on
harassing and
intimidating behaviors.

6B3CD1AAA96A4DE2A9A2AB3178E6AFC9.description:

consequences of sending
sexually explicit pictures or
messages by e-mail or cell
phone or posting sexually
explicit pictures on social
media sites.

BD8CCCA0C1E8425CB39ADDACBCA78E9B.description:
Explain the impact sexually
explicit media can have on
oneâs body image,

ECAEFDC57500412797494A509FA74E1B.description:

intersectionality and
describe their impacts on
sexual health

CF4F3F176C6C4E2B8785FF9197EC5C5F.description:
Describe the relationship
between substance use and
sexual risk behaviors.Â

D6E0E126194C43F3ABE285CF02B61AE6.description:
Describe how the
effectiveness of condoms

and other STIs.

19DA683B5E174DD2832A7BE5D10F536C.description:
Identify solo, vaginal, anal,
and oral sex along with
possible outcomes of each.

BE78A0937D3F43D39A3900D034AFAC2F.description:

active people can reduce
the risk of HIV, and other
STIs.

7AC384ACA5DC4494BE80DBD9715F4C05.description:
Identify ways to prevent
pregnancy, including not
having sex and effective use

F2B5B4127EF2427BBB96E71D72BF27B6.description:
Describe human
reproductive systems

external genitalia and their
functions.

11865167B8274B55BBD10FE2D8258B0E.description:

respecting individual
differences in sexual growth
and development, or
physical appearance.

DBA0F9E18AD8450892BDE1BC14E79371.description:

related to sexual
orientation.

and explain how they may
or may not differ.

6ACF4C1182E24C47A240D3072ED2B224.description:
Discuss what does and does

701CA0EB7B82498DAB94B34ACF2FEB12.description:
Explain why individuals
have the right to refuse

015177ED804844339A37A5E5EFCF8C43.description:

6A3FE068498B4DCCB3B4EA47FA662EDE.description:
Explain the characteristics

other drugs.

Explain why using alcohol,

marijuana products, and
other trending drugs or
substances is an unhealthy
way to manage stress,

C435F5D3CBCD49A4B53DFBF10A90B2E2.description:

alternatives to using
alcohol, opioids, nicotine
products, marijuana
products, and other

substances.

Alcohol,
opioids,
nicotine
products,

Students will comprehend concepts related to health promotion and disease prevention to enhance
health, including:
